vuejs.definition: Vue.js is an open-source model-view-viewmodel front end JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single-page applications.

vuex.definition: Vuex is a state management pattern + library for Vue.js applications.

mongoDB.definition: MongoDB is a document database with the scalability and flexibility that you want with the querying and indexing that you need.

jest.definition: Jest is a delightful JavaScript Testing Framework with a focus on simplicity.

supertest.definition: Super-agent driven library for testing node.js HTTP servers using a fluent API.

vuetify.definition: Vuetify is a Material Design component framework for Vue.js.

nodejs.definition: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

socketio.definition: Socket.IO is a library that enables real-time, bidirectional and event-based communication between the browser and the server.

express.definition: Fast, unopinionated, minimalist web framework for node.

angularjs.definition: AngularJS is a JavaScript-based open-source front-end web framework for developing single-page applications.

foundationsites.definition: Foundation is a responsive front-end framework.

bootstrap.definition: Bootstrap is a free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development.

openapi.definition: The OpenAPI Specification defines a standard interface to RESTful APIs which allows both humans and computers to understand service capabilities without access to source code, documentation, or network traffic inspection.

invision.definition: InVision is the digital product design platform used to make the world's best customer experiences.

heuristicevaluation.definition: Heuristic evaluation is a process where experts use rules of thumb to measure the usability of user interfaces in independent walkthroughs and report issues.

userCentredDesign.definition: User-centered design (UCD) is an iterative design process in which designers focus on the users and their needs in each phase of the design process.
